content: The organisation specified in the Schedule (hereinafter referred to as the Lessors) are the owners of the Insured Vehicle and that the Insured Vehicle is the subject of a Leasing Agreement made between the Lessors of the one part and the Policyholder of the other part. It is further understood and agreed that any payment made in respect of loss or damage (which loss or damage is not made good by repair reinstatement or replacement) pursuant to any legal liability on the part of the Company to the Policyholder under Section I of this Policy shall be made to the Lessors as long as they are owners of the Insured Vehicle and their receipt shall be a full and final discharge to the Company in respect of such loss or damage. It is also understood and agreed that notwithstanding any provision in the Leasing Agreement to the contrary this Policy is issued to the Policyholder namely as the principal party and not as agent or trustee for the Lessors and nothing herein shall be construed as
questions: How does the policy define the relationship between the Policyholder and the Lessors in terms of ownership and leasing of the Insured Vehicle, and how does this affect the payment of claims under Section I?

In the event of loss or damage to the Insured Vehicle that is not repaired, reinstated, or replaced, to whom will the insurance company make payment, and what is the legal effect of such payment on the company’s liability?
What implications does the policy have for the Policyholder’s role as principal versus agent or trustee for the Lessors, especially in relation to claim payments and ownership rights?
How does the policy address situations where the Leasing Agreement contains provisions that conflict with the insurance policy’s terms regarding payment and ownership?
Under what conditions will the Lessors continue to receive payments for loss or damage, and what happens if ownership of the Insured Vehicle changes?

How does the policy ensure that payments made to the Lessors fully discharge the insurance company’s liability, and what documentation or proof might be required to confirm ownership at the time of loss?

In cases where the Insured Vehicle is subject to a Leasing Agreement, how does the policy distinguish between the rights and responsibilities of the Policyholder and the Lessors in the event of a claim?

What are the potential consequences for the Policyholder if the insurance company pays the Lessors directly for loss or damage under Section I, particularly regarding the Policyholder’s financial or legal obligations?
How does the policy’s clause about payment to the Lessors interact with any third-party claims or liabilities arising from the use of the Insured Vehicle?
If the Insured Vehicle is damaged but the loss is made good by repair or replacement, how does the policy treat payments and ownership rights differently compared to total loss scenarios?
What role does the Schedule play in identifying the Lessors, and how critical is this identification for the processing of claims and payments under the policy?
How might the policy handle disputes between the Policyholder and the Lessors regarding the receipt of insurance payments or the handling of claims under Section I?
In what ways does the policy protect the insurance company from double liability when both the Policyholder and Lessors might claim payment for the same loss or damage?
How does the policy address the timing of payment to the Lessors in relation to the occurrence of loss or damage and the submission of claims by the Policyholder?
What are the implications for the Policyholder’s coverage if the Leasing Agreement is terminated or if the Lessors cease to be the owners of the Insured Vehicle during the policy period?
How does the policy ensure that payments made to the Lessors do not affect the Policyholder’s rights or obligations under other sections of the insurance policy?
What documentation or evidence might the insurance company require to verify the existence and terms of the Leasing Agreement before making payments to the Lessors?
How does the policy clause regarding payment to the Lessors interact with any general exclusions or conditions that might apply under Section I or the overall policy?
In the event of partial loss or damage where repair or reinstatement is possible, how does the policy determine whether payment should be made to the Lessors or retained by the Policyholder?
How does the policy clarify the legal relationship and responsibilities between the insurance company, the Policyholder, and the Lessors to prevent misunderstandings in claim settlements?
